Title: JWT tokens identical on successive logins
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login as user 'alice'
2. Note the JWT token
3. Logout (or wait)
4. Login as same user 'alice'
5. Compare tokens
Expected Behavior: Each login should generate unique JWT token with different 'iat' and 'jti' claims
Actual Behavior: Same JWT token returned for multiple logins of same user
Resolution: Added unique 'jti' (JWT ID) to token payload using timestamp and random string: jti: ${user.id}-${Date.now()}-${Math.random()}

Title: Staff event creation test failing with 403
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login as staff user
2. Attempt to create event via POST /api/events
3. Observe 403 Forbidden error
Expected Behavior: Staff user with valid token should successfully create event (201 status)
Actual Behavior: Test received 403 Forbidden instead of 201 Created
Resolution: Updated test to use correct staff username 'dr.smith' instead of 'prof_smith' which doesn't exist in database

Title: Express version exposed in X-Powered-By header
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make any API request
2. Inspect response headers
3. Check X-Powered-By header
Expected Behavior: X-Powered-By header should be disabled or not reveal server technology
Resolution: Recommendation: Add app.disable('x-powered-by') in server initialization. Low priority as it's informational only.

Title: Input validation allows some invalid capacities
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login as staff
2. Create event with capacity: -1
3. Create event with capacity: 0
4. Create event with capacity: 1.5
Expected Behavior: All invalid capacity values should be rejected with 400 error
Actual Behavior: Some invalid values accepted (negative numbers not fully validated)
Resolution: Recommendation: Add comprehensive validation in insertEventSchema using Zod refinements to ensure capacity is positive integer between 1-1000.

Title: No explicit logout endpoint
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login successfully
2. Attempt to logout
3. No logout endpoint exists
Expected Behavior: System should provide logout endpoint to invalidate tokens
Actual Behavior: No logout endpoint available; tokens remain valid until expiration
Resolution: Recommendation: Implement token blacklist or JWT revocation strategy. Current stateless JWT approach acceptable for assessment but should be enhanced for production.

Title: Booking department validation case-sensitive
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Student in 'Computer Science' department
2. Try to book event in 'computer science' department
3. Booking rejected due to case mismatch
Expected Behavior: Department matching should be case-insensitive for better UX
Resolution: Documented as expected behavior; consistent with database schema. Consider normalization if becomes issue.

Title: No rate limiting on API endpoints
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Send 100+ rapid requests to any endpoint
2. All requests processed without throttling
Expected Behavior: System should implement rate limiting to prevent DoS attacks
Actual Behavior: No rate limiting present; all requests processed
Resolution: Recommendation: Implement express-rate-limit middleware with reasonable limits (e.g., 100 requests/15min per IP). Medium priority for production.

Title: CSV export performance not tested with large datasets
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create event with 500+ bookings
2. Export to CSV
3. Measure time
Expected Behavior: CSV export should complete within 2 seconds even with large datasets
Actual Behavior: Only tested with small datasets (< 50 bookings)
Resolution: Recommendation: Performance test with 500+ bookings. Consider streaming CSV generation for very large exports.

Title: No visual regression testing
Expected Behavior: Automated visual regression tests should catch unintended UI changes
Resolution: Documented limitation. Recommendation: Consider Percy or Chromatic for visual regression in future iterations. Out of scope for current assessment.

Title: Accessibility tests are documentation-only
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Review accessibility test file
2. All tests use expect(true).toBe(true)
Expected Behavior: Accessibility tests should use axe-core or similar tool to verify WCAG compliance
Actual Behavior: Tests only document requirements without automated verification
Resolution: Partially addressed: WCAG requirements documented. Recommendation: Integrate @axe-core/playwright for automated accessibility testing in future sprints.
